head.title: Black, White, Gray: America Talks About Race; The Quarterback

hedline.hl1: Black, White, Gray: America Talks About Race; The Quarterback

abstract.p: Maia Ettinger letter on July 2 article about white quarterback at black college, part of series on race in America; quotes quarterback Marcus Jacoby's comment about 'gorgeous light-skinned black girls' as equating whiteness with desirability

block.p: Re ''The Minority Quarterback: Coaches Chose a White to Call the Plays. The Campus Found That Hard to Swallow'' (''How Race Is Lived in America,'' front page, July 2):

Over all, it sounds as if Marcus Jacoby, the first white quarterback at the traditionally black Southern University, gave it the old college try. Still, his reference to ''gorgeous light-skinned black girls'' as potential dating options betrays a disturbing point of view that equates whiteness with desirability.
Re ''The Minority Quarterback: Coaches Chose a White to Call the Plays. The Campus Found That Hard to Swallow'' (''How Race Is Lived in America,'' front page, July 2):

Over all, it sounds as if Marcus Jacoby, the first white quarterback at the traditionally black Southern University, gave it the old college try. Still, his reference to ''gorgeous light-skinned black girls'' as potential dating options betrays a disturbing point of view that equates whiteness with desirability.

Other white people may disagree, but to me, your series underscores how far we have to go to catch up with African-Americans in understanding the role that race plays in this country's social and economic dynamics.
